question.text:
Match the disease/condition with their characteristics.
 
  Disease   Symptom
(1) Haemophilia (i) Broad palm with characteristic palm creased
(2) Down’s syndrome (ii) Delayed clotting of blood
(3) Klinefelter’s syndrome (iii) Gynaecomastia
(4) Turner’s Syndrome (iv) Rudimentary ovaries

options.text: <math><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>;</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>;</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>;</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></math>

<math><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>;</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>;</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></math>

<math><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></math>

<math><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>;</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>;</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn><mo>–</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></math>

solution.text: Haemophilia is a disease that results in delayed clotting of blood in the individual. It is a sex-linked disorder passing from mother to son. Down's syndrome is caused due to trisomy of the <math><msup><mrow><mn>21</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></math> chromosome in the individual. It is characterized by a broad flat face with palm having creases. When an individual with <math><mi>X</mi><mi>Y</mi></math> combination has an extra <math><mi>X</mi></math> chromosome attached that condition is termed Klinefelter's syndrome. This individual will show the development of breast (gynecomastia) with overall masculine characteristics. Turner's syndrome is when the chromosome combination is <math><mn>45</mn><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>, characterized by having rudimentary sterile ovaries.
